For their part, the cable companies wanted to relegate the Big Ten Network to a sports tier, where the fans who watched the games would also be the ones who pay for them.

For the record, while I do not believe in a la carte cable pricing, I do think that sports should be treated as an exception: sports channels are so expensive — ESPN alone is some $3 a month a subscriber — that it is the single biggest reason your cable bill is so high.
